title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye led the Patriots to Super Bowl LX after a surprising 14-3 season, marking a significant turnaround.
Maye's father, Mark, expressed surprise at the Patriots' success, given their previous back-to-back 4-13 seasons.
Despite playoff struggles, Maye's regular season performance included an MVP-caliber completion percentage of 72% and 31 touchdowns.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will call Super Bowl LX for NBC alongside Mike Tirico, marking his fourth Patriots game this season.
Collinsworth has broadcasted five Patriots Super Bowls, including their last matchup against the Seahawks 11 seasons ago.
The Patriots' versatile game strategy this season reminds Collinsworth of their past dynasty years under coach Bill Belichick.

title: Mass. snowplow driver who spotted legs sticking out of snowbank praised for saving older man
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts snowplow driver Matte McGarry rescued an older man from a snowbank in Auburn during Sunday night's storm.
The man fell headfirst into a 3-foot-deep snowbank while walking home and was unable to free himself.
McGarry is to receive a commendation from the Auburn Board of Selectmen for his life-saving actions.

title: UMass student suspended after organizing protest sues university
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: UMass Amherst suspended student Kivlighan de Montebello for organizing a protest against defense contractor RTX at a career fair.
De Montebello filed a lawsuit claiming the suspension violates his First Amendment rights, seeking unspecified damages and record expungement.
University cites necessity for reasonable protest restrictions; lawsuit filed in Hampshire Superior Court argues for protected free speech.

title: More details emerge about children charged with murder in R.I.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Four juveniles, three 12-year-olds and an 11-year-old, charged with murder of 51-year-old Rony Alonso in Providence.
The preteens were identified and arrested after allegedly throwing rocks and attempting assault near the Jan. 19 crime scene.
Initially charged with felony assault, charges were upgraded to murder after Alonso died from blunt force trauma on Jan. 22.

title: Allandale Farm loses second Highland steer following brother’s death last year
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Curtis, a 16-year-old Highland steer, died peacefully at Allandale Farm in Jamaica Plain, Boston, this week.
Curtis's death comes less than a year after his brother Willard's passing; both were popular farm residents.
Allandale Farm invites the public to share memories of Curtis and plans a celebration of his life.

title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox reportedly discussing trading reliever Jordan Hicks to acquire an infielder, focusing on improving their infield lineup.
Pitchers Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval are also mentioned in trade talks as Boston explores using its pitching depth.
Red Sox linked to infielders like Cubs' Nico Hoerner and Astros' Isaac Paredes amid active trade discussions.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: K'Lavon Chaisson had a breakout year with the Patriots, recording 7.5 sacks, 18 QB hits, and 10 tackles for loss.
Chaisson signed a one-year, $3 million contract with New England and expressed his desire to re-sign in free agency.
He credited offensive and interim defensive coordinators for his performance, as the Patriots reached the Super Bowl.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months of treatment for aggressive prostate cancer.
Williams was diagnosed in September 2025 and underwent five rounds of chemotherapy at Massachusetts General Hospital.
Williams will join the Patriots for Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara, traveling with the team for the first time this season.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge City Council unanimously endorses the Plant Based Treaty, becoming the first Massachusetts city to support the global initiative.
The endorsement aims to complement the Paris Agreement by promoting sustainable food systems and reducing consumption-based emissions.
Local residents and officials emphasize plant-based diets' environmental and health benefits, aiming for accessible dietary changes in Cambridge.
